climbs.name: Humble Folks
climbs.fa: Matthew Janse, Chuck Scott, Reed Ames

content.description:
Classic route for the area!

Start up a large flake system past the first two bolts. Clip the 3rd bolt then pull up and right onto a ledge. At the 5th bolt, move up and left to reach a jug and gain the face. Continue past excellent face climbing to the anchor.

* If the crux at the 5th bolt proves too difficult, you can pull on the draw to reach the jug out left. This will bring the grade down to a respectable 5.10 A0.
content.protection: 9 bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Middle of Friendly Faces,Â  just right of The Gift.

content.description: Climb, stem, or scramble your way up past the first two bolts. Continue on great patina holds up to the ledge. A few reachy moves on jugs will get you up to the last bolt and a slab finish to the anchors up and right.
content.protection: 9 bolts to mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Starts on the bottom left side of the Friendly Faces.

climbs.name: The Gift
climbs.fa: J. Voss, C. Scott, C. Miller, R. Hoover, R. Ames

content.description:
Climb up a short vertical face on good holds to gain a small ledge. Continue up the arete past thin and delicate moves.

It helps to use a long draw on the third bolt.
content.protection: 7 bolts, Mussy hook anchor, lower off.

content.description: Climb up a short corner crack to gain a ledge and then continue up and left along a ramp with a thin crack. After a few feet up the ramp, transition onto the face and climb past 5 bolts on the slab above.
content.protection: Gear to 2", 5 bolts. Mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: Left side of Friendly Faces. 10 feet left of Howdy Neighbor. Scramble up past the chockstone to belay.
